article.headline: Brown 69, Fordham 65
article.story: NEW YORK -- Peter Sullivan scored 17 points, including five of six free throws in the last 25 seconds, to lead Brown to a 69-65 win over Fordham on Friday night. Brown held a 58-49 lead with 7:27 left in the second half after Sean McGonagill hit a 3-pointer off an Adrian Williams assist. McGonagill finished with nine points and six assists. Fordham used a 10-0 run, capped by a free throw from Brenton Butler, to take a 59-58 advantage. That's the last time Fordham would lead as Brown answered with five straight points to take a 63-59 advantage on a 3-pointer by Tucker Halpern, who finished with 10 points and six assists. Andrew McCarthy scored 11 points for Brown. Fordham cut the margin to two points with 1:17 left in the second half on a 3-pointer by Butler, but it would pull no closer. Chris Gaston led Fordham with 21 points, while Butler added 17 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
